description: Developments in the field of computing now allow undergraduates to create effective and innovative
applications of powerful computing techniques in any target discipline.  This seminar brings
computer science (CS) students together with students in target (non-CS) disciplines to create
interdisciplinary software applications involving modern high-performance computing that are useful
for research and/or teaching in those disciplines.  Current projects are in linguistics,
environmental science, psychology, mathematics, finance, and robotics.  Students should contact
the instructor (rab@stolaf.edu) before registering for this seminar.
